SASKATCHEWAN ARCHIVES QUESTIONNAIRES.

NO. 4.

PIONEER CHURCHES.

Please print name and address in capital letters.

Your full name __________________________

Present Address __________________________

Pioneer Address __________________________

Year you came to Saskatchewan ________

(Throughout the questionnaire, "Saskatchewan" means the area which is now Saskatchewan)

PLEASE NOTE

This questionnaire is intended for persons who came to Saskatchewan before 1914, and most of the questions are about that early period, although in a few questions information for later years is asked for.

If you cannot answer a question, leave the space blank.

We realize that anyone answering this will not be able to answer all questions accurately, but we urge you to try to answer as many as possible, and leave the others.

Use extra sheets of paper if there is not enough space on the questionnaire.

Your co-operation in answering this questionnaire will be very much appreciated, and all questionnaires are presented in the Saskatchewan Archives as part of the permanent records of our province.

Please send your completed questionnaire to:

Saskatchewan Archives Office,
University of Saskatchewan,
Saskatoon, Sask.

1. To what religious services did you go when you first settled in your district? Church and school. How did you know? As offered by Mr. Tait.

2. How long was it after the first settlers came to your area before services of church worship were organized? 1905-1916.

3. By whom were religious services held in your community before a regular church became established (by a clergyman from some other place, etc.)? Give details of the arrangement, telling where services were held, and give dates if possible.

4. How was the clergyman supported?

5. Was the school house used for church services? Yes

6. Was it used by congregations of more than one denomination on alternate Sundays?

7. Did the same congregation ever support both types of services and give equal financial support?

8. Where did the clergyman (or clergyman) live, and how far was it from the school house?

9. How did he get to the school house to conduct services?

10. Was he entertained in homes or supplied with accommodation for the night? No

11. Were services continued throughout the winter months, as well as other seasons of the year? Yes

12. Who put on the fire for school house services in winter?

13. What other charges, or appointments, did the clergyman have besides the one at your school house?

14. Describe financial arrangements.

15. Were homes or other buildings such as stores used for church services in your community? No
